But some people would like to just watch a cult all day long and stare at a computer screen and some people start to dislike going out or even being a social person. And that can make their life more disheveled because now they're on their heels, they just sit all day anyway. And they should go out and run around. These are my three reasons why I think people shouldn't be on the computer all day. Dear Journal, @ CAPS1 technology has grown exponentially over the past few years. Computer use in particular has exploded. However, I believe this is not something to be excited about. Continued use of computers can affect the health of people, their families and friends, as well as their appreciation of nature. Excessive use of computers is a huge problem. Have you ever sat in front of a computer screen for hours? If so, you know the feeling of drowsiness and irritability. Lack of exercise when using a computer affects people more than they realize. Excessive computer use has been linked to obesity and high blood pressure. the more people use the computer, the higher their blood pressure. Just the act of sitting in front of a screen is terrible on people's bodies. To stay healthy, use the computer only when absolutely necessary. Continuing all the time can separate you from others. This generation, especially teenagers, uses the computer to communicate with others rather than to talk to them. Communicating only by computer can socially alienate them from people. Not to mention the speed at which rumors and secrets have spread across the internet. Computer use can ruin relationships, even those with family. Being careless of family while always on the computer can keep people apart. Families can become a trivial thing. People cannot pay attention to their family when they are sucked into a computer screen. Computers create bogus substitutes for almost everything, even nature. Humans began to live in the wild, gathering food from the earth and giving back by replanting. Our connection to nature was strong. We needed it to prosper. These days, however, instead of listening to the sound of rain and the rustle of dry leaves, people prefer high-pitched artificial beeps and the classic " You've got mail ." People don't appreciate nature the way they used to, as they should. The beauty of nature is simply overlooked as if there is nothing special about it. Well, without it we wouldn't be alive. Life cannot exist without anything to thrive on. We can hop on our computers and look at nature photos on @ ORGANIZATION1. com, or we can take our shoes off and see it for ourselves. No one can experience the greatness of nature on the computer. No one can feel the sensation of cool lake water sliding over their skin or a hot day on @ DATE1 by emailing a friend. It cannot be done. Computers have robbed us of our ability to experience the creature. In conclusion, computers are horrible for people. They can affect health, friends and family, and the appreciation of nature. We should use computers only when necessary in order to stay healthy. Instead of going online, go outside.

These skills are the ability to work simultaneously with the hand and the eyes. These skills can have a number of impacts. The most noticeable are the musical instruments. If you are trying to learn a new song to play on the guitar, you need to move your fingers over the corresponding notes on the screen. Another place where hand-eye coordination is useful is in sports. Football is a sport where hand-eye coordination has a huge impact. If the ball is thrown, the wide receiver should look at the ball with his eyes and make sure he is putting his hands in the best position to catch the ball. I will also discuss the vost world of learning that is provided by computers. Let's just say someone asks you who the @ NUM1 president of @ ORGANIZATION2 was where would you go to find that answer ? To the editor of @ ORGANIZATION2, I am writing to express my opinion on whether computers benefit or harm society. I believe that computers are a great tool for several reasons. First, computers are a learning resource and a way for people to keep up to date with the world around them. Plus, computers make it easier for us to stay connected with our friends and family. Obviously, computers are more useful to people than they are harmful. Life as we know it today would be greatly changed were it not for the advancements in computer technology that have been made in recent decades. Today, if I need to know anything, whether it's for @ ORGANIZATION1 or for my own reason, I can almost instantly research it and get answers from many different sources. It helps people to be more educated and updated with the world around them. Dr @ PERSON2 from @ ORGANIZATION1 recently conducted a study of adolescents with high levels of @ ORGANIZATION1 and concluded that "@ CAPS1 with access to computers performed better on standard tests because of the background information they have acquired online ". Along with the Internet, there are programs such as @ ORGANIZATION4 and @ ORGANIZATION3, which help people learn a new language or write on the computer. In addition, computers keep us abreast of events happening in the world. For example, when the earthquake devastated @ LOCATION1, I first saw it on the news, but got very few details. I researched it online and immediately got the death toll, the help being given, and the ways I could help donate. Without computers, I wouldn't have known any of this. Another reason that computers are so useful to society is that they are tools that help us stay in touch with others. With things like Facebook and @ CAPS2, I can chat with people, invite friends, and even throw parties. Without computers I would need to call each person individually, but with computers I can write a message and send it to everyone at the same time. It gives me more time to do things like playing outside and exercising. Plus, things like @ CAPS3 and Face Book help people stay in touch with old and distant friends. Studies carried out by @ ORGANIZATION5 show that @ PERCENT1 of people with a certain type of social network account have a more active social life than those who do not according to doctor @ PERSON1, this means that these people will have more easier to adapt to different social situations than those who do not. Clearly, this is a big advantage. In conclusion, the computer helps society more than it hinders it. It easily makes it easy for people to stay educated, up to date and connected. It helps people to stay aware of the world around them and to be informed about everything. It makes things that would otherwise take a long time very quickly, giving people the chance to do other things like play outside. It allows people to stay socially capable and active, and allows people to connect with others. Without a doubt, computers are a very good thing.

Recently, there has been a debate about whether or not computers benefit society. Although each party has its own reasons, computers have a positive effect on people and on society. Computers are beneficial in several ways. With the use of computers, you have the opportunity to research and learn about foreign and local places, you are able to communicate with others and help people with their daily tasks. At some point in everyone's life, you need to know local or even foreign places. It is totally unrealistic for someone to go to all the places they need to know. This is where computers come in. On the Internet, you can search for everything from the main staple food in @ LOCATION3 to New Years Day in @ LOCATION1. You learn things from the comfort of your home or hometown. I remember that once in a year @ NUM1, I had to do a research project on @ LOCATION2. By going to the computer I learned everything I needed to know and them some. The project was a snap and I got a perfect score. Additionally, you can learn about upcoming local events and the world around you. During childhood, every child has many questions, some of which their parents may not be able to answer. Using the computer is a quick and easy way to get these answers. Computers help educate the minds of people and without them we might not know anything. Communicating with people halfway around the world is difficult. It may take weeks for a letter to reach the recipient. Computers provide us with an immediate method of communicating with others, whether local or remote. Last year my uncle moved to @ LOCATION3 for work. I never got to see it. We communicated by computer, and when he came home for Christmas, we were as close to each other as before he worked. Computers have kept our relationship healthy and I don't think it would have been that way without them. Scientists say that about @ PERCENT1 of all @ CAPS1 have communicated with someone at least once through computers. They also say that @ PERCENT2 of these people regularly use this method of communication. Although we still use phones and "have to send mail", I don't think our society would be able to function socially without the use of computers. Every day, computers help people get through their days with minimal hassle. People get things done faster, which gives them more time to do what matters most, interact with their families. Without computers, day-to-day business would take about twice as long, leaving less time for the fun things in life. @ PERSON1 my neighbor said "@ CAPS2 and banking is taking so long. I don't know if I would be able to handle it without the ability to do my banking online." In addition to outlets and management, computers help you with everything from shopping to waking up to finding the perfect phone company to use for your new business. Having the ability to shop and browse online takes the time to arrive, walk, and check out, so you can relax and take your time throughout the day. Typing also gives you eye-hand coordination without it, you wouldn't be able to do everyday things like open the door to play sports outside with your kids using computers help people to live their life easier and more efficiently, I couldn't even imagine life without them. Computers benefit people in society in every way possible. By helping them gain knowledge, purifying and strengthening relationships through constant communication ability and helping them to facilitate their daily lives, they have a purely positive effect on people all over the world. Computers have a great effect on people and should continue to be used in everyday society.

They allow us to improve our hand-eye coordination, to learn more about people and places far away and with our friends. Computers improve our hand-eye coordination. Typing is a good way to improve this vital skill by not looking and knowing which buttons are where. Using a mouse is also a good way to improve your skills by moving the digital mouse with the one you are holding in your hand. This can improve greeting writing, as you move the friend around in your hand the same way you move a mouse or type. It can also help with driving, because you can't look at the steering wheel you have to keep your eyes on the word, and in order to do this you know best how you move the steering wheel. Computers can help with hand-eye coordination, which can help with writing and driving, typing, and moving a mouse. Computers can increase our knowledge of faraway places and people. Cultures are diverse and we can all learn from the comfort of our own homes. We can also learn more about nature from our home. Getting to know different cultures can teach us a lot. Like the kind of clothes they wore, the food they ate, the place they lived. It allows us to change our own culture by drawing inspiration from others. Learning about new places can help expand the mind about other places in the world that can lead to vacations. Finally, computers allow us to internet with friends from our chairs. Chat, email, and video chat are all great ways to interact. With a webcam, you can even see the other person as if you were face to face with them. You can also email important files, such as pictures, documents, and even videos. It can help with someone's job. In conclusion, computers can teach us hand-eye coordination, can tell us about faraway places and people, and allow us to interact and share with friends. Computers are a very important part of my life.

Computers can really be dangerous for someone who is not careful. For example, online predators often present themselves as someone they are not. Therefore, you can never really trust someone you've just met in a chat room. Additionally, cyberbullying is another problem that computers put people at risk for. Another danger with computers is that anything posted on the Internet can be viewed by almost anyone. This includes images, blogs, comments and. I believe society would be better off without the constant worry of a computer! Second, people, especially the younger generation, spend too much time on computers. Some people spend hours every day using a computer when they could do an activity that was of real benefit to them. If people spent as much time helping their community as they did the computer, the world would be a much better place to live. Not to mention that it would bring people closer to each other. Computers seem to control people's lives and that just isn't healthy. I think people should spend more time living and less time with their faces glued to a computer screen! Finally, computers are like vampires, sucking your money. In the economy of @ DATE1, people have to save their money for college or even simpler things like a new pair of shoes ! Plus, as technology advances, even the most high-tech computers are out of date in a year or two and a new one is needed. In addition, the prices of computers keep increasing. It is very difficult to follow! I firmly believe that computers are a waste of money and bring society down. Overall, computers are just a negative attribute in communities through @ LOCATION1. First of all, they can be dangerous. Second, they take too long, and third, computers are too expensive. Computers are simply a problem in @ DATE1's world.

Instead, kids sit in front of computer screens on their virtual games and emails, etc. Even doing chores around the house could lower obesity rates much more than sitting on your butt staring at a screen all day. The longer you are on, the more radiation goes to your brain. So we've basically covered the physical effects of computers on your body. The computer can also affect you mentally and socially. If you had just read a book while on the computer, you might have been able to gain knowledge rather than use it. Computers can affect you socially because not everyone wants to sit inside the computer, so while people are having fun you will be on your own, lonely, with no one to talk to except one. computer, would you like a computer to be your only friend? Think about how much you would lose, how much you could never get back, or would you rather do something that you would gain in the future. It's your choice, but be responsible enough to make the one that would benefit you.
Dear Editor, Computers are becoming more and more common in @ LOCATION1. People spend too much time on computers instead of other activities, an effect which is not beneficial to society. Because of computers, people lacked exercise, missed enjoying nature and other parts of the world, and forgot to interact with family and friends. Computers should be used in moderation and not instead of other important events in our life. First of all, computer users exercise much less than those who do not use computers. According to a survey conducted by @ CAPS1 @ CAPS2 @ CAPS3 only @ PERCENT1 of computer users reported exercising at least once a week. In contrast, @ PERCENT2 of non-computer users (infrequent computer users) reported exercising at least once a week. Can you imagine what it would be like if everyone were a loyal computer user? Almost everyone is reportedly overweight, lethargic from lack of sleep from hours spent on the computer, and abnormal. Exercise is an essential part of everyone's life, and lack of it can be bad for your health. Hopping off the computer and exercising instead would make the country healthier and fitter. Computers not only prevent people from exercising, but they also prevent people from enjoying nature and other parts of the world. By traveling to @ CAPS1 and to places unknown to the world, one can discover and experience other cultures. Going the internet @ MONTH1 is a decent way to learn about other places, but feeling the vibe and environment of a foreign place allows for a much deeper understanding of another place. For example. when i went to @ LOCATION2 for vacation i learned about the differences in traditions and culture. I have seen the separation between the poor and the rich as I gaze from the humble sharks along the river to the grand and elegant buildings scraping the sky. It was an experience that I couldn't meet on a computer. People should be able to appreciate the wonders and differences of the world not on a small computer screen, but through the screen of their eyes. Finally, computers prevent people from interacting with their family and friends. From my personal experiences, I tend to ignore friends and family. Talking, playing and generally socializing with others is an essential part of everyone's life. Without this basic necessity, people cannot be happy. In summary, computers should not be used excessively. This type of use could be interpreted by people exercising less, not fully experiencing the world, and having close interaction with friends and family. To create a better country and nation, the people of @ LOCATION1 @ LOCATION1 should make an effort to reduce computer use.

People also type papers and essays for the job. For example, journalists have to write a report and enter it for their company in order to publish it. If business workers had to use computers to classify, type, and design clothes and games. My second reason is that fast food restaurants or even restaurants use computers, instead of using cash registers. For example, @ ORGANIZATION2 or @ ORGANIZATION1 use technology to capture people's orders and the amount they pay. Back then they used cash registers, to withdraw money they had to click a button, but now they're all locked using computers. Every restaurant has at least one touch screen computer to use. Restaurants therefore need computers to survive in the world. My third reason is that schools need computers for students and teachers to write reports, including student names and grades. Students in classes write reports for projects or even for class assignments. Teachers need computers to store student names, grades, and information, instead of using a cupboard. Teachers also use computers to create homework pages and they have to print items from Word. Thus, schools use and need computers for students and teachers. In conclusion, I agree that computers are for the benefit of society, as businesses need them for working, designing and filing, and fast food restaurants so they can take people's orders and use them in places. schools for students and teachers. This is why it benefits society.

They teach hand-eye coordination, make it easy for people to learn about distant places and people, and allow people to talk online with other people. Therefore, I believe that computers have a positive effect on people. Hand-eye coordination is a very important skill to master for young children. Without it, they will have sloppy writing, no chance to play sports and much more. Computers help teach them because they need their finger to hit the same key their eye sees. And because they tend to want to type faster, it will help them even more as the finger and eye will have to work on a mission to type faster. Computers also give people the ability to easily learn about remote places, people, etc. People had to spend hours looking for a half-decent book on a topic, then find the specific information they needed in the hundreds of pages. Now, this information is just a few clicks away. Suppose you had some problem with your faucet it keeps dripping but you don't want to pay for a plumber. You can easily get step by step instructions on what to do with the computer, the possibilities are endless. It's more convenient than using an airplane because you don't need to have something on hand all the time. You can walk away and then come back when you hear that you have received a message. Dear journal @ CAPS1, with computers being so popular right now, it is easy to think that they are useful and have a positive effect on the people who use them. However, I believe that computers have more harmful effects than good on the people who use them. I believe this for @ NUM1 reasons. Firstly, they avoid spending time with real people, they make people exercise less, and they are also very distracting and waste time. One of the reasons I don't think computers have a positive effect on people is that the time spent on the computer could be better spent doing things with family and friends. Nowadays, people use social networking sites like @ CAPS2 and @ CAPS3 to talk with people who are far away. People can spend hours communicating with someone they will never meet and completely ignore the people who care and love them. Additionally, communicating with people online can be dangerous, as the person you are sending a message to may not be who they say they are. Overall, leaving and spending time with real people creates memories that you will cherish for the rest of your life. This feeling can never happen through the Internet. Another reason I think computers have such a bad effect on their users is that constant computer use has resulted in lack of exercise for many people. People who use computers for many hours stay still. They are not active. The only movement that occurs on a computer is the flick of the finger when it clicks the mouse button. Clearly, this is not enough exercise needed to maintain a healthy and happy lifestyle. Studies have shown that since the invention of computers, young people in particular are doing less and less physical activity. I'm sure it will continue to get worse if people continue to spend the majority of the time on their computers. A third reason I think computers have a negative effect on people is that they are distracting and waste time. An example of this is that once, while I was online researching a school project, I saw an advertisement for a website that looked interesting. When I clicked on it, I was taken to a site full of funny stories and pictures. I spent the next half hour reading articles on this website and completely forgot about my project. When I figured out what I had done, I rushed over to finish my research and ended up getting a lower rating at that point. I'm sure I would have had if I hadn't been distracted from other things to do on the computer. That's why I think computers don't have a good effect on the people who use them. They avoid spending time with family and friends, they exercise less. And they waste time and are distractions.

Dear Diary, @ CAPS1 Over the years the streets have become less crowded with people exercising and enjoying nature. Is it good or bad? Technology has advanced so much that it may be better to stay at home and on the computer than to take a walk in the park. Computers have a positive effect on people because they have advertisements that encourage exercise, advertisements that encourage travel and enjoying nature, and computers allow people to interact from anywhere in the world. world. First of all, computers are full of great advertisements. Some advertisements talk about joining a gym and exercising. Studies show that <@ PERCENT1 @ NUM1> of children without a computer don't get enough exercise, while only @ PERCENT1 of children with a computer don't get enough exercise. These statistics show that computers are better for people's health than you might think. Then the computers have even more advertisements that encourage people to travel the world. By doing this, people's intelligence will increase as they will learn new facts about new places. In addition, people will be happier because they love to travel. Finally, people's jobs will benefit if their business depends on the ads they post on the Internet. Finally, the technology used in computers today allows people to talk to friends from almost anywhere in the world on a computer. Social sites such as Facebook allow people to view photos of where their friends have traveled. Webcams allow people to talk face to face from near the new gymnasium they have joined. <@ PERCENT1 @ NUM2> people say they have a better social life online than outdoors when their friends may not be around to talk. In conclusion, computers have a positive effect on people because they have advertisements that encourage people to exercise, travel, and computers allow people to speak from anywhere in the world. Technology is here to make the world a happier, healthier and more social place. This is why computers have a very positive effect on people all over the world.

Dear Diary, I believe that computers have a positive effect on society. I believe that computers have a positive effect because they help us discover faraway places, they help us communicate with our friends and family all over the world, and computers help entertain people. By learning these things you can do a lot of things such as planning a vacation, this information can help you on a report card, this information can also help you learn about your heritage and culture. Computers also have a positive effect and are beneficial to society as they help you communicate with your friends and family all over the world! You can communicate with anyone you know. Nowadays, everyone uses the computer as their primary means of communication. In a study, he showed that @ PERCENT1 of people around the world have a computer as a tool for communication. Finally, computers are good for society because they keep us entertained. There are many things you can do on a computer so that you never get bored. You can play games, surf the web, or watch videos on networks such as YouTube. So on a computer you will never be bored. The computer is beneficial and has a positive effect on society. The computer helps us discover faraway places, it allows us to communicate with our friends and family all over the world, and finally the computer entertains us. That is why the computer is good for society.
I don't think computers benefit society as much as everyone thinks. When people spend most of their time on computers, they don't have time for their families, people don't exercise enough when they are on computers, which makes them obese, and you @ MONTH1 meet a bad person somewhere you met on facebook or myspace. These are the main reasons why computers do not benefit society. The main reason that computers are not beneficial is that you need to spend time with your family. But, when you are on computers 24 hours a day, you have absolutely no time with your family and friends. I believe families should have dinner together and spend at least an hour together. Some great ways to spend time with your family are by playing games together, going for a walk, or even riding a bike together. Did you know that computers have a medium size effect on how obese people become? If you are in school from seven to thirty and after school you spend seven hours on your computer, you will get fatter because you will not have time to exercise at all. When you are just eating and not exercising, your body will not only burn all the fat that you have eaten. When you are on a computer, you are probably going to facebook or myspace. On these chat sites, you can make arrangements to go somewhere with someone you don't even know. If you come across them, it could be a killer, kidnapper, or rapist. So there you can literally die or get hurt because of your computer. This is why email is the safest way to chat online if you have a computer. These are the main reasons why computers are not beneficial to society. Also, you @ MONTH1 don't spend enough time with family or friends, you may become obese because you don't have "time" to exercise, and you may be kidnapped by someone. you don't even know about it via facebook or myspace. What would you like if you didn't have time with your family, were obese, and got kidnapped for meeting someone who thought they were nice through Facebook or even myspace?

Dear @ CAPS1, I believe that computers benefit people today. The invention of the computer helped people send messages and information to each other, helped students in school, and gave children something to do when they couldn't go out. Let me explain. The computer had created an easier way for people to send messages and information to each other. Before the invention of the computer, the only way to convey information was by mail or by telephone. The computer sped up this process. In fact, people had received information about @ PERCENT1 faster with the invention of the computer. I once was able to email my friend asking him to do his homework faster than writing him a letter. Obviously, computers have made communication between people easier. In addition, computers help students in school. Before the computer, a student had to use a typewriter to type papers. Using a typewriter, when they made mistakes that were lit, they had to start all over. It's a whole different story now. In fact, a study carried out by the board of directors of ed. shows that students write papers so much faster and better with a computer rather than a typewriter. I remember my grandfather telling me how he typed papers. It took him about an hour to type some papers. It took her about an hour and a half to write a document on a typewriter, while the longest it took was half an hour on a computer. As you can see, computers have helped students all over the world. Finally, computers provide things for children to do when they cannot go out to enjoy nature. A lot of people would like children to go to their computers when they could go outside. A study by @ CAPS2-obesity shows that @ PERCENT2 of children would rather play outside and exercise rather than in their home on their computer. But sometimes in certain weather conditions the kids can't go out, so they can have fun. A study by @ ORGANIZATION1 shows that only @ PERCENT3 children use their computers when they cannot be outside. If these kids suddenly lost their computing privileges, many of them will not have much to entertain themselves. Clearly, the computer occupies the time of children who cannot go out. In conclusion, the computer has enormous advantages for society. It allows people to send messages and information faster, helps students in school, and gives kids something to do when they can't be outside. I hope this letter has convinced you of the benefits of computers.

Children who did not use the program were found to develop their motor skills at a much lower rate. I know @ CAPS1 helps me immensely with my daily life - and probably yours too - from the most basic tasks of eating and brushing my teeth to typing, drawing and playing the piano. Dear local newspaper, have computers ever hurt anyone? I believe that the effects of computers on people are positive. On the one hand, computers allow people to talk and socialize, even though they are on different sides of the planet. Another effect they have is allowing people to work faster in companies and other jobs that require math. Finally, computers allow people to see distant places and learn almost anything with one click. Thanks to the Internet, people all over the world can talk to each other as if they were neighbors. Let's say a friend or family had to move to another country or state. They can be separated for months or even years. They would constantly miss each other. But with computers, they can talk to each other as if they were still neighbors. Computers also have more "practical" uses. They make it easier to see their inventory, income and even see sales trends. Let's say you had to change the price of your goods, but your car broke down and the incorrect price was miles away. You'd have to wait halfway for a mechanic or run for miles to get to a phone. But with a computer, you wouldn't need to do all of that. Just log in and change the price of the luxury of your own home. There are also educational purposes for computers. Computers allow you to travel the world without taking a step. You can take a trip through the safari or go on an adventure in the raln forest. You can admire the beauty of the great plains or watch the ever-changing sands of the Sahara Desert. You could learn more about the Greeks, Archemedes, Ancient Egypt or Pacman, with a computer, the world is your oyster. This is why I consider computers to be something amazing. Because they let us do things our minds usually can't because they allow people to travel across the world in seconds, and because they allow people in distant oceans to talk together. So think, are computers really dangerous?

Dear Editor, Computers are one of the best things that have ever happened to the human race. They benefit society in every way imaginable and have many positive effects on people. Computers improve hand-eye coordination, allow people to learn about many topics that books don't give them access to, and allow millions of people every day to talk and communicate with friends and family. The most important use of computers is for learning. Using computers, billions of people acquire knowledge they could never have learned before. Many people like me check the weather on the computer daily, making sure we are prepared or dressed appropriately for the weather. Without computers, I wouldn't be able to do this. Also, on days when it snows overnight, I always check the school website when I wake up to make sure the school is always open. It's a useful resource and I don't know what I would do without it. Another thing computers allow us to do is check the news. With the click of a mouse, you can check who won the presidency or what shows are airing tonight. Another amazing aspect of computers is that they dramatically improve hand-eye coordination. This not only benefits my mom who checks her emails five times a minute, but also my three year old little sister who loves to move the mouse and type random letters on documents. It might keep her entertained for days on end, but more importantly, it helps improve her hand-eye coordination with every second she's sitting in that chair. This improved skill will help her immensely in her future when she starts playing sports and cycling soon. Finally, computers allow millions of friends and family to communicate free of charge on a daily basis. If the classmates forgot to write down their homework, they can email the teacher instantly, and find out exactly what the homework is and even open the sheet the teacher attached and print it. . A few weeks ago my dad went to @ LOCATION1 for thirteen days, and it was extremely expensive to talk to him on the phone. So every other day he video chatted with me instead so I could talk to him. hear what he was doing and even see the view of @ LOCATION2 from his window. It was very special to me and could not have been done without computers. As it is so clear, computers help us in so many ways that we forget like educating ourselves, improving our hand-eye coordination, and allowing us to communicate with our friends and family. These are just a few of the positive effects and benefits that computers offer us.

Personally, I think computers benefit society in many ways. It can give you all the information you need with just one click, the entertainment is easy to find by searching the internet and most importantly it improves communication between people. One of the ways that computers benefit society is by making it easier for everyone to get information about something. This is necessary, especially at school. This can help children get their information about the person they are writing about in their report. Getting information easily on the Internet can help people in other ways as well. What if someone needed to get the hospital phone number in an emergency? He can use the computer to help him find that phone number. Another way that computers benefit society is by making it easy for us to obtain any form of entertainment. This is what the majority of people in our society rely on. Many people use the computer to play games, listen to music, and watch videos online. If someone was bored right now, he or she could use the computer to play fun games. What if that person thought it was a bit quiet in their room? He or she could then use the computer to listen to music. Without computers, we would probably be really bored for the rest of our lives. Last but not least, computers help improve communication between people. This is probably what everyone uses the computer for. Now you can email your friends in seconds, post and view photos of your family or loved ones and you can even use instant messaging to write to your friend and receive messages from your friend as quickly as possible ! Without computers, communication between others would be very difficult. As you can see, computers can give you information easily, entertainment is not hard to find, and it can even improve communication between people in our society and the world! Computers are very useful to us and improve everything in the way we live.

The last reason I support technological advancements is that computers can help us with our reading and hand-eye coordination skills. It can help our eye-hand coordination as it can help our fingers move faster and help us get things done faster. I have indicated all the reasons why I support technological advancements. It is not at all good for your health. Exercise gives you energy and is good for you. Have you ever looked out the window and seen how beautiful nature is? When you are on the computer chatting with people and playing with friends online, do you think about what you are missing. Every time I use the computer, I wish I could play outside and enjoy nature. Trees, flowers, plants, grass, and many other things make up the earth, but some people don't appreciate these things. So the next time you're on the computer, think about it. While you waste time on the computer, another homeless child may be wandering around looking for their family. How would you like to be that child who has no family or friends? A lot of people think about their life without a family, but it can happen any day. So I think that instead of wasting time on the computer, we should go and interact with family and friends. Even if it's just having a conversation, maybe it can show them that you really care. In conclusion, I think computers are a waste of time. I understand how people say it's used to communicate with people, but back then they didn't have computers and they communicated so that we could do it. Calculations make you spend less time exercising, preventing you from enjoying nature, and finally interacting with family and friends. You won't go wrong if you listen to someone who uses a computer every day.

People can write letters to each other, but it can take a long time and show up on delivery and response. Dear @ CAPS1, advancements in computer technology have had a positive impact on the society we live in today. Computers teach hand-eye coordination, help children learn inside and outside of school, and connect the world socially. These amazing devices have done nothing to harm the new generation. In fact, they did the exact opposite. Computers are a great way to teach hand-eye coordination. People who oppose the use of computers believe that they only make children lazy and ignorant. This is not the case. Coordination acquired using mouse games in sports such as baseball and lacrosse. Players must watch an incoming ball and guide their stick or mitt to catch the ball. As you can see, coordination is essential in sports. It is also needed for simple daily chores around the house. It can be as easy as taking out the trash or preparing meals. We forget about the fact that easy tasks like these always require coordination. A poorly placed saucepan could pour boiling water on the floor and cause a huge mess. We are lucky to live in a world with such a great teacher of hand-eye coordination. Computers are the most skilled teachers in the world. No matter how hard you try if you are using a computer, you will learn something. The Internet is the best cache of information. Nowadays, the environment is a growing concern. Paper is not made from trees, so it must be cut. It takes forty years for a tree to grow and a few seconds to fell one. Schools around the world should be using computers and keyboards for work rather than paper and pencil. Since most students are familiar with computers, they enjoy working with them more than writing. The average child could learn more in an hour with a computer than they would in a whole day at school. The transition must be made. Computers are also a huge social network. Instant messaging and @ CAPS2 are now the main sources of communication. Without the computers I couldn't talk to my friend who moved to @ LOCATION2 two years ago. This is just one example of the usefulness of social media. They help people keep in touch with old friends and work. All large businesses use computers to invest, sell products, and store information. Computers are the ultimate way to communicate. Obviously, computers are growing in popularity exponentially. The @ LOCATION1 should take advantage of this. Imagine a more eco-friendly country where we don't have to cut down a million acres of rainforest @ CAPS3 @ CAPS4 every year. The benefits of computers are endless. Three of them are hand-eye coordination, knowledge, and communication.

Dear @ CAPS1, computers have really had an impact on society. Some people think they have had a good impact while others think the opposite. I believe that they are a good thing in our lives and that they have had a drastic, but important impact. Some reasons that support my opinion are that computers are fundamentally what helps us stay in touch with people, they make it easier to find the information we need, and they make our school life faster and a lot easier. First of all, computers are pretty much the way people keep in touch. There are many ways to stay in touch through a computer. There are video chat, email and chat websites like @ CAPS2, @ CAPS3, @ CAPS4, etc. A lot of people really like that they can stay in touch this way. It is a step forward compared to the telephone. On the computer, if you are chatting on the web, you can not only talk to them, but you can see them! When it comes to chatting about websites like @ CAPS2, millions of people own and love this amazing website. Kids and adults alike really love having access to something like this. For me, since moving to @ STATE1 and had to give up on all my friends, computers have saved some of my relationships that I thought I was losing but didn't want. I can email my friends and even see what they look like and how much they've changed on @ CAPS2. Computers are a very useful technology that has helped me, and so many other people keep in touch. Another big reason that computers are a great piece of technology is that they make it easy to find the information you need. From the meaning of a word to directions to @ LOCATION1, the computer can help you with it all. I spoke to my mom and she said. "Computers make @ CAPS6 all the information I need about your brother's diabetes so easy." The @ CAPS6 information in the books can take so long. You need to go to the library or bookstore, find the book you need with the correct information, then you need to read the whole book to find the information you need. On a computer, you can just google what you need to find, and read the article or map, etc. Computers have made @ CAPS6 information a snap and everyone loves how easy it is ! The final reason for my opinion is that computers make our school life faster and much easier to manage. In school, there are times when we have to write a really long composition, and it will take forever to write. With a computer, typing the composition would probably take about half the time to write the composition. I conducted a survey of three children who typed a composition and three children who wrote it. I asked each of the children how long it took them. The children who wrote the diary said it took them about two hours. The children who typed the composition said it took them about an hour. Plus, when things are typed, they are usually easier to read, which makes it easier for teachers to grade and doesn't take as long. Computers make school easier for students and teachers. The view that computers are not of benefit to society just doesn't make sense. Yes, I know there can be downsides. But think about all the pros versus the cons. There are a lot more good things than bad things. Without computers, people would be incredibly stressed and have a hard time making their lives easier. Computers are an incredible benefit to society. Everyone should be okay with this because people keep in touch thanks to computers, computers make it very easy to find the information they need, and they make our school life easier and faster for students and teachers. Computers have had an extremely big impact and have changed our lifestyles for the better !

What is technology? Technology is defined as anything that helps improve our way of life. Technology is all around us. Our beds, homes, televisions, and even our chairs are all forms of technology. There is, however, one form of technology that, in my opinion, has revolutionized modern life as we know it. This form of technology is called the computer. My view of the effect of the computer on our society is quite positive. Just think of all the things we rely on this device for. There is one thing, however, that really occurs to me; @ CAPS1. The computer is perhaps the greatest form of @ CAPS1 the world has ever seen. Email is basically sending a letter to a friend without having to post it where it could be lost or stolen. The e-mailing is done in two simple steps: @ CAPS2 and @ CAPS3. Not only does this reduce the risk of the letter not arriving, it is also much faster. You hit the ' sen ' button and before you know it there's a new letter in your friends' inbox. Another computerized @ CAPS1 method is my favorite, instant messaging. Instant messaging allows you to have a conversation with someone who might be miles away. And it's okay if you decide to go grab a soda while you're instantly chatting, because unlike real conversation, it's not rude. These are just two methods of @ CAPS1 that the computer allows us to have. There are a variety of others that just like these two improve our way of life. I believe the main reason the computer has made our lives so much better is because of one giant thing: the Internet. The internet makes everything we do on the computer possible. If I want to go to the computer and do some research on a topic, the Internet takes me where I want to go. With millions of different websites, the Internet offers endless possibilities. If I am interested in arcade games, I can go on the internet and play it. If I have to write a scientific report, I can go on the Internet and collect research. If I want to listen to music, I can go to the computer, search for a song, and listen to it. And guess what? If I'm looking for a funny video just for a laugh, then the internet can find me one! The internet is perhaps one of the greatest things ever invented. It's just another reason to love the computer.

Dear local newspaper: I strongly believe that computer technology has a negative effect on people in our society. People in our society spend too much time on computers and not enough time exercising and interacting with family and friends. By starting now, we can make a difference in the lives of thousands of people. First of all, I would like to say that it is important that we exercise daily. If we don't make exercise part of our daily routine, we are potentially putting our health at risk. Activities like walking a dog, biking, or going for a good jog in the park are just a few ways to improve your fitness. Participation in extracurricular activities can also play a major role in exercise. It not only helps physically, but also mentally. Finally, another method of exercise is to play a part in your local community service projects. Exercising every day is just one way to stay active and away from the computer. Finally, interacting with your family and friends can help you avoid the computer. Playing games is one way that can help you stay in touch with your family. It can bring you closer to the people you love and help them get to know you better. Moreover, you can play with your friends and thus develop social skills. Who knows, developing social skills might help you in the future. Plus, by interacting with your family and friends, you can learn to be relaxed and let your life take its natural course. This is another helpful technique that can improve the quality of your life and save you the temptation to be on the computer. In conclusion, techniques such as exercise and interacting with family and friends can help you avoid the computer. By working together and trying these methods, the computer can be eliminated from our daily routines.

It's just a place to educate, and if anyone is offended by what they see, they should stay away from the library. I have been to the library several times, and I have never seen anything offensive. Everything I have witnessed in the library is for learning and research. There are some sections in the library. It's a way of learning and researching and it would be next to impossible to censor everything there. Everyone is going to be offended at some point in their life. If libraries removed anything that could offend someone, they wouldn't have any documents left. People need to stop being so easily offended and realize that the library isn't trying to harm anyone. There is no need for censorship in libraries. It's just trying to teach people about the world and allow them to enjoy books, music, movies, or whatever you might find in the library.

The idea of removing "offensive" material from libraries is understandable. Some believe that this material is not appropriate for anyone to view it. However, because we all have different opinions on what is offensive, I believe that books that are found to be offensive should not be taken off the shelves in the library. First, I believe that if this policy were in effect in libraries, there would not be many books left on the shelves. Offensive is a relative word. That @ MONTH1 is offensive to one person @ MONTH1 is not offensive to another. Everyone has a different opinion on different issues depending on their beliefs and life experiences. Many books contain things that people disagree with, but expressing that is part of free speech. Therefore, if everyone complained that they found an offensive book or movie, there would be next to nothing left, as Katherine Paterson said. The purpose of a library is to provide people who use the library with a resource. If sources were censored in this way, it would be difficult to get information. Sometimes it is even beneficial to read a point of view or the opposite side to get more knowledge on a certain topic and see things from a different perspective. However, some @ MONTH1 books are not quite suitable for some people. For example, some materials in the @ MONTH1 library are not the best for small children to read or view. In that case, I don't necessarily think they should be taken off the shelves rather than put in a place that these kids don't have access to. Having books, music, movies, or magazines taken off the shelves if they are found to be offensive in my opinion is a ridiculous notion. It hinders expression. People have different opinions about what offends them and it would be very boring if everyone thought the same thing. If anyone finds something particularly offensive, I think they just shouldn't see it.

The library is a path to knowledge, which branches off on many different cultural routes. It has grown from a simple place of books to a building that also houses music, movies, magazines, and other forms of media. But, the question arises as to whether certain materials should be excluded if they are found to be offensive. There are several ways to approach this question. Is censorship a response to offensive content or a response to what is not " politically correct " ? Often times people will claim that some work is unfair without understanding the point of view of the alleged victim. It's quite ironic that those in power - who defend the offended parties - often don't understand them better than the creator of the work. Another reason for censorship is to protect children from unwanted content, which is very understandable. But where in the process do parents control exactly what they want their children to access. I believe it is the parent's responsibility to determine such restrictions. If a parent gives a child unrestricted access to material in a library, then the child should be able to explore where their curiosity takes them. If the parent chooses to limit access, they must be active in the selection process. It is the right of those who have given birth and are raising these children to determine how they are guided. I myself am a musician, which is no more artistic in a way than any other creator, such as an author. My designs are expressions that I give the world to appreciate and think about. To remove an author's work from a library is to undermine his ability to disseminate his thought. Of course, there are other outlets for acquiring books, but the library is one of the best. There are some complications that will arise in censorship of libraries. What guidelines do you have for determining the exclusion of offensive material ? If a material offends a person, is it enough to exclude it, or do you need a larger group? It is unrealistic to always achieve full consensus on a group's opinion, so how do you determine what is offensive and what is not. Overall, I think everyone should have the opportunity to acquire whatever material they want from a library. It is an institution that allows a person to go to places they will never go and live a life they will never live. Its ability to do so must not be compromised.

Do you find some material offensive and want libraries to remove them ? @ CAPS2 is a major problem that many people don't often think about before they act. Here are a few situations that many people encounter : If one person finds an @ CAPS1 offensive but no one else finds it, should we delete @ CAPS2 ? Many libraries are wondering whether or not they should remove an offensive material due to the opinion of some people. It's because they know people like @ CAPS2 and they know people don't know them ; they are wondering whether or not they should remove the item because a few people find @ CAPS2 offensive (this could range from books, music, movies, magazines, etc.). People often think they are doing what is best for everyone by asking library staff to remove something they find offensive. Honestly, they only help people who want to remove @ CAPS2 and say nothing i.e. if the library removes the offending item. If the library deletes the offending item, it @ MONTH1 loses a client, if it does not delete the item, it @ MONTH1 loses a client. They are therefore faced with a dilemma : "to delete the item or not to delete the item ?" " @ CAPS2 is a difficult decision, especially when @ MONTH1 lose more than a few customers based on one or the other choice. So what are they doing? They @ MONTH1 poll customers and see what they think, they @ MONTH1 do nothing at all, or they @ MONTH1 delete the item to satisfy the person. The problem is what happens if @ CAPS2 is a friend who liked the article and you don't want to hurt their feelings because the article has been around forever and they like @ CAPS2 so much, but can't afford to buy @ CAPS2 at one store. What are you doing then? What are we hiding from? Is personal expression really that bad? Such questions come to mind when the subject of censorship in libraries arises. In my opinion, I think banning artwork in libraries is destroying the people @ CAPS1 created them. Censorship in general is a way of hiding reality and watering down the struggles within life itself. You cannot learn unless you have the opportunity to face the problems of society and the world. By banning certain parts, the world destroys an opportunity to expand the knowledge of each individual. With the removal of materials such as books and music, libraries are wasting the time spent and the hearts that creators have placed with confidence. Although most people use these materials strictly for entertainment purposes, writers and musicians have created them to express themselves and to show their pain and struggles. One could even say that such an expression is therapeutic for these specific individuals. How would you react if your art form was not suited to an audience? Would you be hurt and taken back? Many artists probably feel that they are placed in a state of isolation and hatred. With creating art, there is always a deeper meaning behind them. The biggest question to me is, " @ CAPS1 considers this material inappropriate for libraries " ? What is so wrong with specific material that we have to take it away from everyone ? At the rate our world is going today, there will be no more individualism in the next fifty years. If people aren't even allowed to listen to specific types of music, sooner or later people won't be able to wear certain types of clothes or even dye their hair a different color. The greatest gift of the human population is their ability to be different. If our society can't even handle freedom of expression through art, how can it handle any other kind? Libraries are created as a place to expand knowledge. If the documents are censored, how can we learn ? Each individual has their own way of thinking and interpreting topics. A book considered entertainment and free time reading for one person @ MONTH1 is the very thing that strikes a world-changing idea in another's mind. The greatest idea of a human comes strictly from the knowledge that he has accumulated throughout his life and from his interests. If certain art forms are censored, individuals will never be able to find that form of interest in certain subjects. Everyone will be strictly forced to believe and learn the same things, limiting the world of magical ideas a man could have formed with information obtained from art that had been censored. How can one specifically influence the beliefs of a child @ CAPS1 is only @ NUM1 or @ NUM2 years old based on their personal selfish beliefs ? Do libraries think that if they don't publicly post a review topic, no one will know? Knowledge is all around us. No one needs a book to tell you that our world is not perfect. As far as we know, a censored book could have saved millions of lives. I cannot fully grasp the concept in my head of hiding documents from the public. There will soon come a time when all expression will be censored. If we are getting rid of art, should we also be removing people? I can relate censorship of books to censorship of people based on my own personal experience. A teacher once told me that I would never complete my career because I have piercings. Such opinions could kill a person's dreams. I knew I wanted to be a lawyer from the age of seven and worked to improve my studies according to my goals. I can almost guarantee that most people have had worse experiences than what is covered up. The world cannot be sugar coated or presented as perfect, because that is not life. Everyone will have a hard time at some point and their artwork will really get us through that. Sometimes we relate to them or, in my case, to art like music, that's what makes me feel better when I'm hurt. The pain will always be there. Today, after many years, this is considered a trivial matter and it is now a legal right for women to vote. I have been reading since I reached first grade. To be honest I couldn't give you the @ PERCENT1 names of them because ... well, I just can't remember. I'd like to think it's because I have a horrible memory, but the truth is, they were just unappealing and unforgettable books. In all respects these books could be considered a waste of my life. Back then, I guess I was only reading them because I had nothing better to do, which is horrible because you should read books because you want to. Fortunately, there is light at the end of this tunnel. Every once in a while you come across a book that changes your life. Not literally, but it's like that at the moment (that's how you should feel). These are the books I remember. These “ life changing ” books all contain things that would interest anyone who took them. Unfortunately, these things would be viewed as inappropriate by a select audience. For example, a book @ MONTH1 is about murder and is viewed as very offensive by someone whose mother has been murdered, while the same book might be viewed as a work of art by someone who has escaped it. horror of death. Apparently it got to the point where people would have books censored or had them removed from libraries altogether. I can no longer remain inactive. Books all go through a long and tedious process before they are ready to be put on the shelves. They must be written, read and selected for publication. For some books, it can take years. To completely alienate these books is extremely unfair to the time spent on them. If you don't like books, don't read them. It's that simple. If that's not reason enough for you, think of it this way: A book about a child who is raped and struggles to overcome it could serve as an inspiration for rape victims. Or, a book about the death of someone's parents might help a child in the same situation overcome their grief. All books have a purpose and should remain on the shelves of local bookstores, regardless of the methods used. Even if they aren't your thing, it could be a whole different experience for someone else halfway around the world. May these books fulfill their function.

If you were an author, musician or director, wouldn't you want your work seen and published as you originally wrote it? Most of these people would and get mad when their work is edited. They want their work to be heard, and sometimes by removing the disrespectful things, the message is not understood as clearly as it would be with those certain words. Most would not like this at all and strongly encourage editing of things their children are too young to hear and understand. Eventually, however, children are going to be faced with these things. In recent years, censorship in libraries has been the subject of much coverage. In almost all cases, library patrons were annoyed that certain materials were deemed unsuitable for donation to the library. I must say I agree with them. People have the right to choose what books they want to read, what movies they want to watch, and what music they want to listen to. People have opinions; people don't agree. What one person likes, another person might hate. But just because one person dislikes or is offended by material on a library shelf does not mean that all other users should be denied the opportunity to use that material. I think if a resource is viewed by one person and one person is able to learn or appreciate the resource, then the library has served its purpose and helped the community by offering this material. There are over six billion people in the world. This means that there are over six billion different personalities and opinions of all these distinct people. It would be next to impossible to remove all aspects of the media that might be deemed offensive, because almost everyone is offended by something. Some media can be found more offensive than others, but it is likely that this is something the author is passionate about and the author might be offended if his opinion is rejected. Now that the Internet is accessible in almost every place in the world. Media that was previously only on shelves are now displayed online, which can never be permanently removed from public view. It is illogical to think that simply removing material from libraries would prevent different groups of people from being offended by the media. There is a big difference between awareness and offense. Some books and magazines may just intend to explain a type of culture and raise awareness on the subject. However, there is a definite line that goes as far as the offensive and can easily be crossed by authors around the world. It is therefore in the interest of these authors to take into account the people they write about. It is important to avoid stereotypes as they can be hurtful. There is already a lot of offensive literature in the world and finding everything and restricting everything would be just irrational. If a person is offended by something someone has written, they should just avoid reading it. However, this does not give writers the power to target a group in their writing and specifically offend them. It is a very two-sided subject. It cannot be strictly controlled by library censorship; it is also in the hands of authors and readers around the world. Authors and media producers should consider others and strive to raise awareness rather than offend. In this regard, readers around the world should keep in mind why the author might target them and avoid conflict by avoiding material. It is by no means fair to target and offend a group of people in a piece of literature; However, this is a practice that has been practiced before and just removing the materials from the shelves will not prevent it from being exploited. Libraries are already sharply declining in their importance around the world. All new technologies have hurt them and they are unlikely to become more important again than other resources, like the Internet. With that in mind, how much would library censorship really help these offended groups around the world ? Most likely, they wouldn't even notice a change. Everyone has the right to have an opinion and to share it, but it is also important to keep the feelings of others in mind. The world is full of different media that many people have access to, so writers and producers need to think outside of themselves before putting them on the shelves.

We learn our history for a reason, does this all sound like a situation or two the world has been through before? Erasing things from life hasn't done any good before. If we start to listen to the facts of people who disagree with one thing, we will listen to the next one, what happens when all of a sudden people come back and say they don't like women with blond hair. or the green-eyed men? The world is going to crumble and burn before our eyes, and if I can identify these things at age fifteen, then some have to identify things at fifty, accept that the world has its flaws too. So just because I agree with everything I said, are you going to agree with that too? No, I know you won't, but think about it when you expect others to agree with what you say or think. When I think about people who cut down on the things they don't like, I can already see the world losing its pathetic value that it has earned, and we @ MONTH1 don't all love this world but we can't. to lose. Accept the world as it is, because this is what you live in and this is what you have, because without it nothing would be nothing. Try to fix broken things, not eliminate shredded things
offensive materials in libraries should not be removed from shelves because of their content. Writing is an art form, and censoring what an author writes could obscure their message. people live on the streets and in public places daily, so censorship in libraries would not protect anyone. Removing books from libraries altogether could also interfere with research or school projects the children are to work on for class. Writing is an art form, and censoring what an author writes could potentially obscure a major message or theme in the novel. This style of writing can be seen in @ PERSON1's novel To @ CAPS1 a @ CAPS2 from @ PERSON1 using offensive terms for @ CAPS3 @ CAPS4 to define that of racial tension in the south at this time. This type of censorship would also be detrimental if a reader studying the Holocaust cannot see the images of the death camps due to the graphic nature, the reader would not be able to understand the true horror of the camp without it. People live around the offense every day at home, on the streets and even at school. A normal person has several occasions a day when he @ MONTH1 hears name calling in the street from strangers or passing friends. Parents sometimes curse or use profanity in front of their children to prove a point or simply by accident, and this would expose children to offensive behavior just as much as adults. Children are also exposed to coarse language and behavior when going to school and working with children who might be engaging in offensive behavior. Censorship of books in libraries could interfere with school or work-related projects and research. Censorship could be a problem if a student could not get a book about a war or major event due to its graphic nature, hampering the ability of students to complete their work effectively. It could also cause problems if a teacher needs to rent a book that contains slight profanity but is unable to do so because of the content, preventing them from teaching their students the topic and lesson. Content-based censorship of books should not be allowed in libraries. first, trying to censor a novel can obscure the message or theme. Second, people live with profanity every day, so trying to censor them wouldn't protect people as they've probably heard what is being said in the novel before. finally, library censorship could interfere with work or school projects or research. If all libraries were censored, it could potentially cause several complications for workers, students, or people just looking for a good book to read.
Libraries are sometimes connoted as very boring. Walking around the islands looking at all the books and wishing they were all more interesting. Within minutes of browsing the only shelf you've rummaged for what seems like hours, you catch a glimpse of a very interesting title. Inside this book there could be countless inappropriate images and profanity on every page. Who is to blame for opening the book and reading it? Profanity, nudity, and crass humor, along with a lot of other things, are all over the media, including books. Some parents try very hard to keep their children away from these things by telling the child that they just cannot watch, listen or read certain things. Parents usually don't say why they don't let their child see, hear or read these things, other than “ it's bad and I said no ”. If parents told their child precisely why they are not supposed to be exposed to certain things, the child might not be so inclined to get involved in these things. Not only should parents teach their child why they shouldn't be exposed to these things, but maybe they should be there when their kids have a chance to see things they shouldn't. And if a child is too young to see, hear or read certain things, then he is far too young to browse a library or any other place where he is not properly guided by a parent. Censorship, in my opinion, should not be done by libraries, film producers, television programs and record labels, it should be done by the parents of a child.

Freedom of the press is a right that few countries have. America is the land of the free. For some, having so much freedom does great things. Without freedom of the press, many of the most classic modern literature would not exist and their messages would be unknown. To censor the right to write freely about one's worldview, government, or whatever, is to deprive of imagination and, in some cases, of statistics and events related to the past. Before today's technology, books were one of the only ways to acquire knowledge, and the process of making and publishing a book took so long that it was an honor to receive the one of the rare copies produced. People are thirsty for information, they love to learn and progress. If all the books deemed “offensive” were removed from the shelves, the information would slowly be removed and the pleasure of reading would disappear. In the brilliant novel @ CAPS1 @ NUM1 a man who lives in a Distopian society discovers the lack of literature. All the books found in the houses were immediately taken out and burned in the streets for everyone to see. The kids found it funny and the adults didn't do anything. The man goes through the novel with a secret reserve of books of his own. Once discovered, he is on the run to protect his precious knowledge which the government tries to hide from the public. Censorship would only create chaos and destruction as in the novel. Having the right to know the history of your country or what is going on in your current government is essential in schools and colleges. Parents are often offended by authors schools choose to have students read, claiming that their ideas and ways of thinking are too stubborn and wrong. Students need books to grow and learn, and if each person chose a book to permanently remove from the shelves, there would be no more books. Eventually, all information would come from what we knew before the books were banned and gone for good. Books are a story in themselves, no one wants to hear the raw truth about certain topics such as slavery or the possibility of full government. In order to avoid hearing about it, one could simply choose a more fictional novel in which to escape into a fantasy of their own. No one can change the story, however they can exaggerate certain events and without the book or the quote it is from, one could completely change the view and thoughts of the public about the past. If someone is offended by a certain book, they have their own freedom to write or report a negative blog. Writing is a gift that few have naturally and being able to show your talent is a privilege. Books help people escape the difficult world we live in or help them gain more knowledge. Censorship is irreverent, because having all forms of music, movies and magazines stripped of the truth, what does that leave? People always tell the truth or tell a "white lie", but most of the information is factual. The freedom to write and make books, music, and movies isn't just about entertaining people. The messages behind said "offensive" material could be quite strong and although the author is long gone, his message could last for decades.

Censorship is one of @ LOCATION1's most broken laws. It is illegal to censor any publication such as books, magazines, music, or movies. Censorship most often occurs with books in a school setting. Censorship should no longer be tolerated because it affects writers, the school system and especially readers. In @ ORGANIZATION1, everyone has the right to express their feelings and opinions on any topic they want. School systems take away this right by not allowing them to have a certain book in a school. Schools should be a place for all books or a place for no books at all. The faculty of a school does not have the right to decide which books are allowed in their school based on their own ideals. It is not fair for the writer to be criticized, and that writer should have the right to have his book read in any context. The next group affected by censorship within a school system is the school system itself. If a school is allowed to take one right away from a group of people without punishment, then it could start taking away other rights. In general, school systems and teachers are powerful leaders in a school's student body. They make rules just to show their power over students and take away many of their rights. If schools are allowed to continue censoring books, it could lead to a downward spiral of censorship. As Katherine Paterson once said, “ We can all think of a book that we hope none of our children ... take off the shelves. But if I have the right to take away the book that I abhor ... then you have exactly the same right ... And then we don't have any more books on the shelf for any of us. ' The government of @ ORGANIZATION1 must crack down on school censorship because it is unconstitutional. The last major group of people who censor within a school system are potential readers and students. To censor a book is to take that person's ability to learn and understand a certain subject that has been censored. Students in a school should have the right to read whatever they want to read regardless of the beliefs and ideals of the school. In conclusion, censorship in any setting, but especially in schools, should no longer be tolerated as it affects writers, school systems and potential readers. Schools are taking constitutional rights away from all potential readers. The government of @ ORGANIZATION1 must crack down on the illegal practices that occur in schools, across the country, every day
